column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Came here for one of our very first dates and still remember the taste very well. It was a super busy ramen joint on a Saturday night. Tables were waited on a first come first serve basis. The restaurant was small
column2: but very cozy and contemporary looking. Though we waited almost an hour to get a table for 2
column3: our food came out pretty quickly. For some reason
column4: the eggs didnt have much flavor that night but ramen noodles and broth were really tasty. Our spicy ramen bowl was a bit too spicy for us
column5: but overall tasted very rich and flavorful; they were not super salty as some ramen bowls could be.
